timeline.bodyText: @olenagerasimova looking at add and remove comments it seems that Credentials interface assumes that it's data is stored in YAML. Is it the case? If it's for YAML credentials only then I'd suggest to rename the interface accordingly and describe it in class comments. If it is supposed to handle credentials in other formats as well, then corrections should be made to methods' comments.

timeline.bodyText:
@olenagerasimova casting creds to Credentials.FromStorageYaml might cause problems in the future due to types mismatches in runtime. I have two solutions in mind:

Signature of CompletionStage<Optional<Credentials>> credentials() method may be changed to CompletionStage<Optional<Credentials.FromStorageYaml>> credentials() in this class. Settings interface remains untouched.
CompletionStage<Authentication> auth() method may be added to Credentials interface and creating AuthFromYaml is moved to auth() implementation in Credentials.FromStorageYaml.
What do you think?
timeline.author: olegmoz

replies.bodyText:
@olegmoz hm, I like the second option better, it will be more flexible and handy when we will have other Authentication and Credentials implementations. And technically we have credentials from env now, we can create corresponding Credentials implementation letter.
Do you mind if I todo your suggestion?
